zone.line: Shall we onward? Come along!
Every thing around is swept
Forward, onward, far away.
Trees & masses intercept
The sight, & wisps on every side
Are puffed up & multiplied.
Meph.
Now vigorously seize my skirt, & gain
This pinnacle of isolated crag.
One may observe with wonder from this point
How Mammon glows among the mountains —
Faust
Aye —
And strangely through the solid depths below
A melancholy light like the red dawn
Shoots from the lowest gorge of the abyss
Of mountains, lightening hitherward; there rise
Pillars of smoke, there tender clouds float by
Here the light burns soft as enkindled air
Or the illumined dust of golden flowers
And now it glides like tender colours spreading
